0: Police are still investigating the death of an infant who was found not breathing at a day care in Lehigh Township on Friday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR But the Carbon County coroner says that the 3-month-old did not show any signs of trauma. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “I can tell you there’s no trauma. We are investigating, but it doesn’t look like it’s going to be (suspicious),” Coroner Robert Miller said Monday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Lehigh Township Police said Friday they were investigating the death of a 3-month-old. The girl was found not breathing Friday afternoon at Sharon’s Day Care, located on Third Street in the village of Treichlers, and pronounced dead at Palmerton Hospital a short time later. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR An autopsy was conducted at Lehigh Valley Hospital on Saturday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Miller said that it revealed no signs of trauma. However, a cause and manner of death are still pending. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Miller said that process could take more than three months. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Sharon’s Day Care has had no serious violations at least going back to 2014. During their most recent inspection in January, inspectors noted four violations regarding paperwork for enrolled children, but they were all corrected within two weeks, which is in compliance with state law. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Lehigh Township police were unavailable for comment. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In a news release put out Friday night, police said they were called to the day care around 3:30 p.m. for the unresponsive infant. Police and emergency personnel attempted lifesaving efforts at the scene before the child was transported to Palmerton Hospital. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR An obituary identified the victim as McKenna Rose Felmly, daughter of Adrienne L. Kromer and Bryan S. Felmly of Slatington. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR An online fundraiser dedicated to McKenna’s memory was posted on GoFundMe.com. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In the post, Felmly reportedly said that Friday was the first day that McKenna had attended day care after Kromer, his fiancee, had taken three months of maternity leave. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The fundraiser has already exceeded the goal of $5,000, raising in excess of $8,500. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “Please kiss your babies for McKenna. We would like each and every child to receive McKenna kisses,” the site for the fundraiser reads.
